head.title: Joy in Gotham: New York Takes Series!; The Glory of Today

hedline.hl1: Joy in Gotham: New York Takes Series!; The Glory of Today

abstract.p: Kenneth M Coughlin letter, commenting on October 18 article, says World Series between New York Yankees and New York Mets will not only allow city to show off its two splendid baseball teams, but its rejuvenated mass transit system as well; drawing

block.p: New York's first Subway Series in 44 years (front page, Oct. 18) gives us a chance to show off to the rest of the nation not just our two splendid baseball teams, but our rejuvenated mass transit system as well. This system will make it possible for a weeklong sports extravaganza to take place without endless traffic snarls and the resulting noise and pollution.

New York's first Subway Series in 44 years (front page, Oct. 18) gives us a chance to show off to the rest of the nation not just our two splendid baseball teams, but our rejuvenated mass transit system as well. This system will make it possible for a weeklong sports extravaganza to take place without endless traffic snarls and the resulting noise and pollution.

It would be a wonderful gesture if, for at least one game each, the Yankees and Mets players renounced their sport utility vehicles and sports cars and instead rode the train from their home park to the opposing team's field.
KENNETH M. COUGHLIN New York, Oct. 18, 2000
